question_text: Which of the following are true statements about the differences between PCL and PostScript? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: PCL is generally faster for simple text documents
PostScript is better for cross-platform output consistency
PCL and PostScript use the same printer memory model
PostScript jobs are usually larger and more resource-intensive
correct_answer: PCL is generally faster for simple text documents
PostScript is better for cross-platform output consistency
PostScript jobs are usually larger and more resource-intensive
explanation: PCL is fast and efficient for basic documents. PostScript provides better graphical consistency but typically uses more resources.
